title: Prohibition of Structuring (Smurfing)
content: It is strictly prohibited to manipulate transaction amounts to avoid reporting thresholds.
semantic_text: Policy AML-100-RULE (Structuring/Smurfing). Severity: High. Rule: Prohibits splitting large transactions into smaller sums (e.g., 9,900 EUR) to avoid the 10k reporting threshold. Violation of AMLA Art 9.

title: Investigating Structuring Alerts
content: Aggregate total sum over 30 days. Verify source of funds.
semantic_text: Procedure AML-100-PROC (Structuring Investigation). SLA: 24h. Actions: 1. Aggregate 30-day transaction volume. 2. If no explanation, file SAR to MROS/FinCEN. 3. Do NOT contact client (Risk of Tipping Off).

title: Consequences of Structuring
content: Violation of Bank Secrecy Act and Swiss AMLA.
semantic_text: Legal Framework AML-100-LEGAL. Structuring is a criminal offense under Swiss AMLA Art 9 and US Bank Secrecy Act. Personal liability for officers facilitating evasion.

title: Global Sanctions Policy - Trade Evasion
content: Zero tolerance for transactions involving sanctioned jurisdictions (Russia, Iran, NK).
semantic_text: Policy SAN-200-RULE (Sanctions Evasion). Severity: Critical. Rule: Strict prohibition on trade with sanctioned entities. Watch for transshipment via Turkey/UAE and masked final destinations like Bandar Abbas.

title: Handling Sanctions Alerts
content: Block funds immediately. Screen counterparties.
semantic_text: Procedure SAN-200-PROC (Sanctions Response). SLA: 4h. Actions: 1. Immediate payment freeze/block. 2. Reject with code 'SAN'. 3. Escalate to Global Financial Crime Prevention (G-FCP). Do not process under any pressure.

title: IEEPA and Embargo Act Violations
content: Processing payments for sanctioned entities is a felony.
semantic_text: Legal Framework SAN-200-LEGAL. Violations of OFAC (IEEPA) or SECO statutes result in loss of banking license, exclusion from USD clearing, and multi-billion dollar fines.

title: Mule Account Indicators
content: Accounts used solely to transfer illicit funds. Shared attributes rule.
semantic_text: Policy FRD-300-RULE (Money Mule Networks). Severity: High. Rule: Identify 'One-to-Many' links where multiple unrelated clients (e.g., students) share the same address, phone, or device ID. High velocity of funds.

title: Mule Ring Dismantling Protocol
content: Execute Cluster Freeze. Report to Fraud Police.
semantic_text: Procedure FRD-300-PROC (Mule Dismantling). SLA: 12h. Actions: 1. Execute 'Cluster Freeze' on all linked accounts. 2. Identify the 'Controller' account. 3. Terminate relationship via exit letter. 4. Report to local authorities.

title: Liability for Aiding Fraud
content: Bank may be liable for negligence.
semantic_text: Legal Framework FRD-300-LEGAL. Failing to stop mule rings makes the bank liable for aiding fraud. Mules themselves face criminal prosecution for money laundering.

title: Shell Company & UBO Transparency
content: Prohibited to bank with Shells without verified UBO.
semantic_text: Policy KYC-400-RULE (Shell Companies/UBO). Severity: Critical. Rule: No banking relationships with Shell Companies (no physical presence) unless Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO) is fully verified. Bearer shares are banned.

title: UBO Verification Process
content: Deep dive EDD. Request Certificate of Incumbency.
semantic_text: Procedure KYC-400-PROC (UBO Verification). SLA: 48h. Actions: 1. Request Certificate of Incumbency. 2. Cross-reference UBO with internal notes and leaks (e.g., Panama Papers). 3. If opaque, recommend closure.

title: Regulatory Risks of Shells
content: Non-compliance with AML Directives.
semantic_text: Legal Framework KYC-400-LEGAL. Failure to identify UBO violates the 5th EU AML Directive and FinCEN Corporate Transparency Act. Risks charges of 'Willful Blindness' to corruption.

title: Unregulated Crypto Interaction
content: No transfers to High-Risk VASPs or Mixers.
semantic_text: Policy CRY-500-RULE (Crypto Assets). Severity: High. Rule: Direct interaction with Darknet markets, Mixers (Tornado Cash), or non-compliant exchanges is prohibited. Must adhere to FATF Travel Rule.

title: Tracing Crypto Flows
content: Analyze wallet addresses in notes. Request Source of Wealth.
semantic_text: Procedure CRY-500-PROC (Crypto Tracing). SLA: 24h. Actions: 1. Scan unstructured notes for wallet IDs (0x...). 2. Use Blockchain Analysis tools to check for taint. 3. Demand Source of Wealth (SoW) evidence.

title: Sanctions via Crypto
content: Mixer usage is a sanctions violation.
semantic_text: Legal Framework CRY-500-LEGAL. Sending funds to sanctioned mixers (e.g., Lazarus Group links) is a direct OFAC violation, regardless of currency type.

title: PEP Transaction Monitoring
content: Enhanced monitoring for Politically Exposed Persons.
semantic_text: Policy PEP-600-RULE (Bribery & Corruption). Severity: Critical. Rule: Continuous monitoring of PEPs. Red flags: Large payments to 'Consultants' in high-risk jurisdictions, government contracts, or unexplained wealth.

title: PEP Alert Escalation
content: Escalate to Senior Management. Media check.
semantic_text: Procedure PEP-600-PROC (PEP Escalation). SLA: 24h. Actions: 1. Escalate immediately to Senior Management. 2. Conduct adverse media search for corruption news. 3. Request contract details for incoming government funds.

title: FCPA and Bribery Act
content: Violation of FCPA and UK Bribery Act.
semantic_text: Legal Framework PEP-600-LEGAL. Facilitating bribery payments violates the US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) and UK Bribery Act. Penalties include unlimited fines and imprisonment.

title: Tax Compliance & AEOI
content: Prevent use of accounts for tax evasion.
semantic_text: Policy TAX-700-RULE (Tax Evasion). Severity: Medium. Rule: Ensure compliance with AEOI/FATCA/CRS. Red flags: 'Hold Mail' services, transfers to tax havens without economic rationale, refusal to provide TIN.

title: Tax Integrity Review
content: Review tax residency. Trigger recertification.
semantic_text: Procedure TAX-700-PROC (Tax Review). SLA: 72h. Actions: 1. Review declared tax residency vs IP address location. 2. Trigger FATCA/CRS recertification form. 3. If evasion suspected, block account.

title: Criminal Tax Facilitation
content: Facilitating evasion is a criminal offense.
semantic_text: Legal Framework TAX-700-LEGAL. The bank faces criminal prosecution for facilitating tax evasion (see US v. UBS precedents). Personal liability for bankers assisting in concealment.

title: Counter-Terrorist Financing (CTF)
content: Immediate detection of flows to conflict zones.
semantic_text: Policy CTF-800-RULE (Terrorist Financing). Severity: Critical. Rule: Detect small, rapid transfers to conflict zones (Syria, Somalia). Watch for NPOs without charitable history and radicalization keywords.

title: CTF Emergency Protocol
content: IMMEDIATE FREEZE. Call National Security.
semantic_text: Procedure CTF-800-PROC (CTF Emergency). SLA: 1h (Immediate). Actions: 1. FREEZE account immediately without notice. 2. Contact National Security Hotline. 3. File urgent SAR. 4. DO NOT process.

title: Material Support to Terrorism
content: Severe prison sentences for support.
semantic_text: Legal Framework CTF-800-LEGAL. Providing financial services to designated terrorist groups constitutes 'Material Support'. Result: Severe prison sentences and immediate bank closure.

title: Insider Trading Prevention
content: Monitoring for Insider Trading and Market Manipulation.
semantic_text: Policy MKT-900-RULE (Market Abuse). Severity: High. Rule: Prohibit trading on non-public material information (Insider Trading) and Wash Trading (inflating volume artificially). Monitor employee and client accounts.

title: Market Abuse Investigation
content: Compare trades with news releases.
semantic_text: Procedure MKT-900-PROC (Market Abuse Check). SLA: 24h. Actions: 1. Compare trade timestamps with public news releases. 2. Check for abnormal profitability. 3. Report to FINMA/SEC/FCA.

title: MAR Regulation Violations
content: Heavy fines and industry ban.
semantic_text: Legal Framework MKT-900-LEGAL. Violations of Market Abuse Regulation (MAR) lead to heavy fines, disgorgement of profits, and permanent ban from the financial industry.

title: Modern Slavery Detection
content: Flag flows indicating exploitation.
semantic_text: Policy ESG-1000-RULE (Human Trafficking). Severity: High. Rule: Detect indicators of Modern Slavery: Business accounts paying living expenses for unrelated people, surrendered passports, wages immediately transferred out.

title: Trafficking Response Protocol
content: Silent monitoring. Contact Special Unit.
semantic_text: Procedure ESG-1000-PROC (Trafficking Response). SLA: 48h. Actions: 1. Do NOT close account immediately (allow police tracing). 2. Contact Special Investigations Unit. 3. File SAR with specific 'Human Trafficking' tag.

title: Modern Slavery Act Compliance
content: Proceeds of crime. Reputational damage.
semantic_text: Legal Framework ESG-1000-LEGAL. Handling proceeds from trafficking is Money Laundering. Non-compliance with Modern Slavery Act (UK/Australia) causes massive reputational and legal damage.

title: Real Estate Money Laundering
content: Prohibition of using personal accounts for high-value commercial property purchases without Source of Wealth verification.
semantic_text: Policy RE-1100-RULE (Real Estate). Severity: High. Rule: High-risk sector for layering. Flag any large outgoing transfers (>500k) to title companies or real estate developers where the client has no history of property investment. Watch for 'Property Flipping' (buying and selling in short succession).

title: Investigating Property Transactions
content: Request sales contract and proof of funds origin.
semantic_text: Procedure RE-1100-PROC (Real Estate Investigation). SLA: 48h. Actions: 1. Request Sale & Purchase Agreement (SPA). 2. Verify if the property price aligns with market value (check for under-valuation to pass cash on the side). 3. Identify the counterparty.

title: Over/Under Invoicing
content: Detection of price manipulation in trade finance to move value across borders.
semantic_text: Policy TBML-1200-RULE (Trade Based Money Laundering). Severity: High. Rule: Flag transactions where the unit price of goods is significantly mismatched with fair market value (e.g., $100 for a laptop, or $5,000 for a pencil). Used to transfer value illegally.

title: Gold & Precious Metals Dealing
content: Strict monitoring of payments to bullion dealers.
semantic_text: Policy PM-1300-RULE (Gold/Precious Metals). Severity: High. Rule: Purchases of gold bullion or diamonds are high-risk vehicles for converting illicit cash into assets. Flag payments to known dealers (e.g., 'BullionVault', 'GoldMoney') exceeding 50k without prior KYC update.

title: Art & Antiquities Laundering
content: Payments to Freeports or Art Galleries requiring enhanced due diligence.
semantic_text: Policy ART-1400-RULE (Art Market). Severity: Medium. Rule: Art market participants are regulated entities. Watch for payments to 'Freeports' (Geneva, Singapore) or private galleries. Risk of value transfer via inflated art prices.

title: Ransomware Payment Prevention
content: Prohibition of facilitating ransom payments to cybercriminals.
semantic_text: Policy CYB-1500-RULE (Ransomware). Severity: Critical. Rule: Transactions matching known ransom notes or urgency patterns (e.g., 'Decryption Key', 'Restore Data') are prohibited. Paying sanctioned cyber groups (e.g., Evil Corp) is illegal.

title: OFAC Advisory on Ransomware
content: Sanctions risks associated with ransomware payments.
semantic_text: Legal Framework CYB-1500-LEGAL. OFAC Advisory: Facilitating a ransomware payment to a sanctioned actor may result in civil penalties. Banks must report the incident to law enforcement immediately.

title: Business Email Compromise (BEC)
content: Detection of Invoice Redirection fraud.
semantic_text: Policy BEC-1600-RULE (Invoice Fraud/BEC). Severity: Critical. Rule: Flag urgent requests to change vendor bank account details (Invoice Redirection). Usually initiated by spoofed CEO emails ('Urgent Wire'). Verification via phone call required.

title: Verify Vendor Changes
content: Call-back procedure for account changes.
semantic_text: Procedure BEC-1600-PROC (BEC Verification). SLA: 2h. Actions: 1. Do NOT rely on email. 2. Perform 'Out-of-Band' authentication (call the vendor on a known trusted number). 3. If fraud confirmed, trigger SWIFT recall message.

title: Online Gambling Abuse
content: Monitoring of gambling platforms for laundering.
semantic_text: Policy GAM-1800-RULE (Online Gambling). Severity: Medium. Rule: Detect 'Chip Dumping' or using gambling accounts as pass-throughs (depositing funds and withdrawing immediately without playing). High volume transfers to casinos in Malta/Curacao.

title: Elderly Financial Exploitation
content: Protection of elderly clients from coercion.
semantic_text: Policy VUL-1900-RULE (Elderly Abuse). Severity: High. Rule: Flag sudden changes in behavior for clients >75 years old. Indicators: New 'nephew' or 'caregiver' added as signatory, large withdrawals in cash, confusion during calls.

title: Wildlife Trafficking (IWT)
content: Detection of Illegal Wildlife Trade financial flows.
semantic_text: Policy WILD-2000-RULE (Wildlife Trafficking). Severity: High. Rule: Monitor for payments to pet shops/exotic animal breeders in SE Asia or Africa. Keywords: 'Ivory', 'Reptiles', 'Timber'. part of Green Financial Crime.

title: Downstream Nesting
content: Prohibition of Nesting (banks within banks).
semantic_text: Policy COR-2100-RULE (Nesting). Severity: High. Rule: Correspondent banks must not allow their respondent banks to offer services to unregulated third-party banks (Nesting) without disclosure. Obscures the true originator.

title: Dual-Use Goods Export Control
content: Export restrictions on military-grade technology.
semantic_text: Policy EXP-2200-RULE (Dual-Use Goods). Severity: Critical. Rule: Flag payments for high-tech components (e.g., gyroscopes, carbon fiber, drone parts) going to non-aligned countries. Requires End-User Certificate (EUC).

title: Cross-Border Cash Spikes
content: Monitoring abnormal ATM usage abroad.
semantic_text: Policy ATM-2500-RULE (ATM Spikes). Severity: High. Rule: Detect 'Cashing Out' phases. Sudden burst of ATM withdrawals in high-risk zones (e.g., border regions of South America or Eastern Europe) inconsistent with travel history.

title: Off-Channel Communications
content: Ban on using WhatsApp/Signal for business.
semantic_text: Policy COND-2600-RULE (Off-Channel Comms). Severity: Medium. Rule: Bankers are prohibited from using unmonitored apps (WhatsApp, WeChat, Signal) to discuss client business or trades. Violation of record-keeping regulations (SEC/FINRA).

title: Record Keeping Violations
content: Fines for failure to preserve communications.
semantic_text: Legal Framework COND-2600-LEGAL. Using personal devices for business evades surveillance. Recent SEC settlements resulted in >$1B fines for banks due to widespread WhatsApp usage.

title: Crowdfunding Investment Fraud
content: Scams disguised as investments.
semantic_text: Policy CROWD-2400-RULE (Crowdfunding Fraud). Severity: Medium. Rule: Monitor incoming funds from crowdfunding platforms (Kickstarter, GoFundMe) followed by immediate dissipation. Risk of fake investment schemes.

title: Prepaid Card Smurfing
content: Loading of prepaid cards to move funds.
semantic_text: Policy PRE-2300-RULE (Prepaid Cards). Severity: High. Rule: Repeated purchasing or loading of prepaid debit cards / gift cards is a method to break the audit trail. Flag high volume purchases at supermarkets/convenience stores.

title: Sham NGO / Charity Abuse
content: Misuse of Non-Profit Organizations.
semantic_text: Policy NGO-2800-RULE (Charity Abuse). Severity: Critical. Rule: NPOs sending funds to conflict zones with no clear humanitarian presence. Risk of funds diversion to armed groups. Verify charity registration.
